channel.title: Need help with port foreward
channel.description:
Well i followed the Tut. But when i run my Server (i downloaded figmentscape 4.5) and when i click runserver a dos window comes up and it says -FigmentScape- .. Online!
But when i try to log into my client with the silab webclient i get error connecting to server, so im guessing i need the port foreward thing? So i google my ip but i dont get anything like it says. can anybody help? im trying to create a server for my first time as you can probably tell.

item.title: Need help with port foreward
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“gibsondude, post:5, topic:218855”]i did… i would say it but idk if your supposed to say your ip. but anyways i only get these nooby sites that come up.[/quote]That’s your gateway, you can tell us. The advanced number (usually not 192.168.2.1 is your info but it will do no harm). Please tell us your router.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port foreward
item.dc:creator: @jamesbrooks jamesbrooks
item.description:
@jamesbrooks wrote:

you will need username and password, try admin for user and pass[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2008, 12:43:50 AM[/size][hr]what ip, internal (LAN network) or external (internet)

item.title: Need help with port foreward
item.dc:creator: @jamesbrooks jamesbrooks
item.description:
@jamesbrooks wrote:

Start > run
Then type cmd
In the black box, ip config
theres a default gateway, type that in your address bar

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port foreward
item.dc:creator: @gibsondude gibsondude
item.description:
@gibsondude wrote:

I tried that =/ when i search my ip on the addres bar no site comes up that lets me edit settings of my router.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port foreward
item.dc:creator: @i_lured_i i lured i
item.description:
@i_lured_i wrote:

You can log in and play bye yourself if you run the server and use “127.0.0.1” as your ip. But if you want other people i’d suggest using a “how to make a server” guide on the forums.

For portforwarding help go to portforward.com

~Affinity~

Read full topic
